page.title: 18TRELLECH CHURCH
page.content: THE FOCAL POINT OF TRELLECH VILLAGE IS THE LARGE GOTHIC CHURCH OCCUPYING THE CENTRE OF THE VILLAGE. THE CHURCH GOES BACK TO THE 13TH. CENTURY, PROBABLY REPLACING AN EARLIER NORMAN ONE. SURROUNDING THE CHURCH IS A LARGE CHURCHYARD,LOOKED AFTER, WITH GREAT CARE, BY ALAN WATKINS. THERE HAS NOT BEEN A VICAR SINCE APRIL 1984. IN AUGUST 1985 JOHN DENERLY FROM KENT IS GOING TO BE THE VICAR OF TRELLECH, PENALT, AND CHAPLAIN OF THE CONVENT. A SMALL BUT ACTIVE SUPPORT FOR THE CHURCH IS GIVEN BY TWO READERS, AND ORGANIST, SECRETARY, AND A FLOWER SECRETARY. THE CHURCH IS HEATED BY GAS. APART FROM REGULAR CHURCH SERVICES, IT IS ALSO USED FOR WEDDINGS, AND FUNERALS.
